intro: Tristania albicans, commonly known as the white tristania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Tristania albicans is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
